Yes, I can provide more information regarding the importation of electronic waste for proper treatment and disposal.

In Indonesia, the importation of electronic waste is regulated by the Ministry of Environment and Forestry, which is responsible for issuing permits and overseeing the proper management of electronic waste. There are specific regulations that outline the conditions under which electronic waste can be imported, such as the requirement for proper treatment and disposal facilities, and the need for environmentally sound management practices.

For example, the Indonesian Government Regulation No. 101/2014 on the Management of Electronic Waste outlines the procedures for the importation and management of electronic waste in the country. This regulation requires that electronic waste imported for treatment and disposal must be processed in accordance with Indonesian environmental regulations and must not pose a threat to human health and the environment.

In addition to the regulations in Indonesia, there are also international agreements that regulate the importation of electronic waste, such as the Basel Convention. This treaty requires that electronic waste be managed in an environmentally sound manner and that it not be exported from developed countries to developing countries without the consent of the receiving country.
